竟然忘了写这篇评测（也许是因为太好玩所以给忘了？）
经过传送门1的洗礼之后，再玩起传送门2就不像最开始那样的无所适从了
相比1代来说，2代不仅画面上有进步，而且也多了不少新的解谜元素
由于有双人模式和创意工坊的存在，使得2代比1代的游戏寿命也要长的多，更加耐玩
真希望能有传送门3的出现，可惜G胖似乎并不会数3 xD

--------------------

最后，如果有谁苦于没有双人模式的队友的话可以找我
虽然通关了但我也不介意再打一遍，因为双人模式真的太欢乐了hhhhh

Even Solving a high school Mathematics sum didn't gave me as much satisfaction as Solving a puzzle in this game..

As a Christian father, I choose not to allow video games into my household, but occasionally my boys will have sleep overs with other Christian families that might be more lax than ours. Imagine my surprise the other day when I overheard my second oldest boy talking about a video game he had played at a friend’s house. As soon as I heard the name “Portal 2”, my suspicions grew and I immediately found myself wondering which body part the game might be referring to.

I rushed to the computer that I keep locked away from my impressionable children, and what I found was truly disturbing. Just 10 minutes of Bing research produced so much evidence that this game was a homosexual recruitment tool that I have now forbidden it. You better believe that I called the other father and gave him a good talking to. As a devout Christian, he agreed with me and has now burned his Portal 2 DVD on his barbeque grill to make sure this threat to his family is gone for good.

Here are some of the things I have learned: This game is made by Valve software, a wholly owned subsidiary of NAMBLA – the people who invented child molestation. Just the name “valve” produces images in the mind of a Christian man that should not be there.

Game play takes place in a giant gay bath house, where children are encouraged to use their mechanical ♥♥♥♥♥ guns to create glory holes. In case you haven’t heard of this filth, “glory holes” are all the rage in gay circles, where sweating homosexuals drill holes into walls and then perform sex through them, without having to show their guilt ridden faces. There is one thing a homosexual hates, and that is for their shame to be seen in the light of day. That is why their bars and bath houses are kept so dark at all times. And believe me friend, this game is dark and shadowy.

Glory hole in the game.

Glory hole in homo-gay bath house. Hard to tell the difference, right?

There are two adorable robots. Who doesn’t love robots? Kids sure do. Well, these 2 robots are a homosexual couple. The tall one is the dominate bear and the little one is the swishing bottom. Even the voices are clearly transexual which is a dead give away. I shudder to think of what life style choices a little child will think is decent after pretending to be one of these two mechanical gays. Instead of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, they have glowing red and blue lights in their sex area.

As if that was not enough, there are mechanical testicles and gay saunas around every corner. Not enough? Well this game introduces “gels” which help the innocent children slide through a glowing red sphincter.

I could go on, but my stomach is turning at this latest homo-gay invention. There is nothing christ-centered in this game. Protect your children from this latest assault from the gay agenda.

Played back in 2015 on the PS3, still an absolute blast to play again.
Even if you've already played through the game there are a good handful of achievements and secrets that keep the game's replay value. and hell, the community test chambers provide literally endless amounts of content.

Вот оно счастье, спустя 16 часов мы прошли Портал в кооперативе. ААА
Сколько криков, разногласий, недопониманий, сложных головоломок, и в конце концов командной работы.
То что помогало нам пройти игру, это конечно же командная работа.
Сколько ж сообща работы мы проделали, что бы пройти до определенного момента, совершить определенное действие.
Фух
В общем, ачивка получена, можно приступить к прохождению доп части.
Правда концовка, хм, не такая как я ожидал, но все же я доволен, измученный мозг получил свою дозу.
Çok iyi bu bulmaca oyunu herkeze tavsiye ederim . Ayrıca grafikleri de çok iyi ve çogu bilgisayarda kasmadan  oynayabiliyorsunuz

I love this game, (along with its predecessor), I cant get enough! I love the singleplayer, multiplayer, community test chambers, mods and everything else, if you haven't played the game yet, I HIGHLY recommend it because its a great puzzle game and definitly my favorite game of all time. Interesting story and gameplay. The only thing I could THINK of saying bad is that it is pretty hard at first, but over just a little bit of playing, you get into the feel of it. I would also recommend playing Portal 1 first, for story and gameplay reasons. Again, I HIGHLY recommend it and I hope if your reading this you at least consider buying and playing it.
Çok müthiş bir oyun zeka gerektiren herkese öneririm.

Amazing. Mind blowing after all these years.
One of the best games ever made. They really know how to make a deep story with hardly any dialoge. The gameplay is really interesting and challenging.

+ Puzzles are not too hard to solve or too easy.

+ Easy to run on mid to low range hardware.
+ Gorgeous design and graphics.

Overall Rating (9.0/10)

This game is fun and has some great comedy and unexpected twists in the story. Except for a really good single player experience it also has a good co-op mode for two players.

The first Portal was a groundbreaking game where progressed throught test chambers like a lab mouse in the hands of a big A.I./Robot called Glados. You were told that there would be cake, but in the end, the cake was a lie. You defeated Glados since "she" were trying to kill you and then you escaped the underground test facility called Aperture laboratories.

A long time later, by the looks of it, the story of Portal 2 begins. You, this time as another test subject, still alive in the facility are having a really long sleep when you are woken up by a small robot stuck to a rail system in Aperture laboratories. He wants your help to get out of there and as a team you begin your journey towards freedom. What we know is that Aperture laboratories is really old and deserted and that Glados was defeated a long time ago...

Get this game, it's really good! There could even be a cake in it this time!

[h1]人类与人工智能的故事[/h1]
portal1给我们留下了太多太多的疑问，什么是光圈科技？Glados又是怎么产生的？为什么墙上会有奇奇怪怪的涂鸦？
Portal2接portal1的剧情，讲述光圈科技的起源，Glados的背后，人类与人工智能的故事。不说惠特利智障，还是Glados傲娇，在我心里，portal的故事已经完美了。
至于雪儿出去的故事？我想，或者联合军已经离开了地球，或者是从麦田里跳出来了个猎头蟹……
我不会死心的，我依然期待着半条命2：第三章和半条命3。

A classic puzzle game with great voice acting and timeless mechanics...

But this one has a 2 in it!

Порталы — это элементы игровой механики в серии Portal. Порталы размещаются ручным портальным устройством; они работают как пространственный туннель между двумя точками игрового мира. В одиночной игре игроку даются порталы оранжевого и синего цвета. В совместном режиме у Атласа они синие и голубые, у Пи-боди — красные и оранжевые. Одиночные порталы выглядят как овалы однородного цвета, а двойные имеют в центре пустоту, служащую проходом во второй портал. Порталы могут переносить объекты, имеющие физические свойства. Порталы также могут пропускать потоки света и гравитации, из которых состоят экскурсионные воронки и мосты плотного света.
Good Stuff Companion cube/10
muito bom o jogo recomendo e muito
Not much to say other than look at the ratings. One of the best games on steam by far :)

So fun.   Regretably Portal and it's followup just don't have a lot of replayability once you know how to beat the puzzles.   But don't get it for that.  Get it for the same reason you get a good book.  Because it's good and after you've read it you're satisfied.      

 There's a lot of clues and hints around the game world.  Dialog is fun even though you don't ever speak.   Chell must be Gordan Freemans sister from another mother.   Anyway both portals are well worth spending time with.  Plus you'll finally understand why the cake is a lie!

作为一名从小玩fps游戏长大的玩家，
这款游戏， 真的给不了好评。
短短不到10分钟的开场动画以及过关时的电梯，头晕得想吐。
从未在任何其他第一人称游戏有过这样的体验。
Incrivel

It's about 2 times longer than the first game, and puts more effort into progressing the story than the first. Only thing is that it feels a bit drawn out in certain parts for the sake of adding some length to the game, [spoiler]like the whole section where you're dropped into the "old" aperture and you slowly make your way back up, i just feel it could do without all the walking after you wake up and make your way to the first chamber, just my personal opinion.[/spoiler] Aside from that minor complaint, Valve does a great job at slowly introducing new concepts and gradually building them up into more complex puzzles. The characters felt well written and were very expressive, especially Wheatley; his animations really helped convey how he was feeling about what was happening in the game. All-in-all, fantastic puzzle game, with slightly more emphasis on characters and story than the previous game. 9.7/10
Just... perfect! I have nothing else to say. ;)

As if Portal wasn't already perfect, Portal 2 expands on the success of its predecessor and adds brilliant new single- and multi-player campaigns to satisfy your hunger for more test chambers. The multi-player campaign in particular is a wonderful experience, especially if you can play with someone love!

Fun (and better) sequel to Portal 1, Portal 2 is a fun strategy game with portals, and I guess gel??? The feeling you get when you complete one of the harder puzzels, be it with your friends or solo, is thrilling. Once you've beaten the Campaign, there's still Multiplayer and Workshop levels to do. Overall, this is a enjoyable physics Strategy game with portals that you should pick up if you have some extra change and are into these kinds of games.
